page.title: 09Wheat at Upper Lutheredge.
page.content: The wheat crop is planted at the end of September and harvested in the middle of August.It has{11 months growth so it will produce a greater yield. The ear grows from November onwards,but it is inside the stem. If you split the stem you should be able to see the ear and the{5}internodes inside. The stem elongates like a telescope. Disease prevention is practised as on the barley crop. Wheat and barley have{1 tonne}an acre{less}if they are planted in the Spring.The grain is sent to Ethiopia for famine-relief and also to Ireland. Wild oats are like a weed in a crop. This plant can stay in the ground for over a {100 years}and still germinate. There is a new grain crop called triticalli,and as it is less prone to disease, farmers can grow it more cheaply.
